IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: CAL FARLEY'S BOYS RANCH AND CAL FARLEY'S GIRLSTOWN, U.S.A. (BOTH LOCATED IN THE TEXAS PANHANDLE) ENJOY A LONG-HELD NATIONAL REPUTATION IN THEIR HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL RESIDENTIAL INTERVENTIONS, WHICH OFFER AT-RISK CHILDREN A SELF-CONTAINED CAMPUS AND A CHRIST-CENTERED, FAMILY-ORIENTED ENVIRONMENT. CHILDREN LIVE IN HOMES OR COTTAGES AT BOTH CAMPUSES. TEN TO TWELVE CHILDREN LIVE IN EACH HOME; HOUSE-PARENT COUPLES PROVIDE 24-HOUR PARENTING, SUPERVISION, AND MENTORING. CAL FARLEY'S OPERATES A CONTINUUM OF SERVICE, WHICH BEGINS WITH THE SUPERVISED, FAMILY-STYLE RESIDENTIAL SETTINGS DESCRIBED ABOVE, AND PROCEEDS TO ALUMNI AND TRANSITIONAL CARE FOR BOYS AND GIRLS AS EACH BEGINS TO ASSUME THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF MORE INDEPENDENT LIVING. TO ADDRESS THE GROWING NATIONAL NEED FOR POSITIVE RESIDENTIAL INTERVENTION FOR ADOLESCENT GIRLS, CAL FARLEY'S GIRLSTOWN USA'S TRANSITIONAL LIVING PROGRAM FOCUSES SEE CONTINUATION AT THE END OF SCHEDULE O..................
IRS990.MissionDescription: CAL FARLEY'S BOYS RANCH IS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT PROVIDES CHILDREN WITH A HOME, FRIENDLY CARE AND GUIDANCE, VOCATIONAL TRAINING AND GENERAL EDUCATION AT THEIR BOYS RANCH AND GIRLSTOWN CAMPUSES.
IRS990.Description: BOYS RANCH CAMPUS OPERATIONS:DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, CAL FARLEY'S BOYS RANCH SERVED 387 BOYS AND GIRLS RANGING IN AGES FROM 6 TO 19 AT THE BOYS RANCH CAMPUS. FROM OCTOBER 2009 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 2010, 31 RESIDENTS GRADUATED FROM BOYS RANCH INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DISTRICT WHO HAD AN AVERAGE LENGTH OF STAY AT BOYS RANCH OF 3.97 YEARS.

Activity2.Description: GIRLSTOWN, U.S.A. CAMPUS OPERATIONS:DURING THE FISCAL YEAR SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, CAL FARLEY'S SERVED 42 GIRLS RANGING IN AGES FROM 11 TO 18 AT THE GIRLSTOWN, U.S.A. CAMPUS NEAR WHITEFACE, TEXAS. FROM OCTOBER 2009 TO SEPTEMBER 2010, 5 RESIDENTS GRADUATED FROM NEARBY WHITEFACE HIGH SCHOOL WHO HAD AN AVERAGE LENGTH OF STAY AT GIRLSTOWN OF 2.68 YEARS.

Activity3.Description: ADMISSION AND FAMILY LIAISONS:DURING THE YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, CAL FARLEY'S CALL CENTER ANSWERED OVER 3,941 TELEPHONE CALLS THAT RESULTED IN INFORMATION ABOUT CAL FARLEY'S PROGRAMS SENT TO 1,413 CALLERS AND 2,007 REFERRALS TO OTHER AGENCIES AND RESOURCES.DIRECTORS AND STAFF OF THE FIVE FAMILY RESOURCE CENTERS CARRIED A CASELOAD OF 22 FAMILIES PER STAFF WITH A TOTAL AVERAGE OF 169 FAMILIES PER MONTH ASSISTING THEM WITH TRAINING AND OTHER WAYS TO STRENGTHEN THEIR FAMILIES AND RELATIONS WITH CHILDREN. THROUGH THE ALUMNI SUPPORT SERVICES AND CAL FARLEY'S INDEPENDENT LIVING PROGRAM, 45 ALUMNI WERE PROVIDED WITH HOUSING AND OTHER LIVING ASSISTANCE DURING THE YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2010.

ActivityOther.Description: CAL FARLEY'S BOYS RANCH PROVIDED SUPPORT TO CAL FARLEY'S BOYS RANCH INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DISTRICT FOR ITS OPERATIONS.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part IV, Supplemental Information: PART II, LINE 10 EXPLANATION: MISCELLANEOUS INCOME INLCLUDING DISCOUNTS EARNED AND REBATE INCOME.

OtherAssets.Description: RECEIVABLE - BOYS RANCH INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DISTRICT
RECEIVABLE - CAL FARLEY'S BOYS RANCH FOUNDATION

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE INTENDED USE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO BE HELD INDEFINITELY AND THE INCOME FROM WHICH IS GENERALLY UNRESTRICTED AND USED FOR OPERATIONAL PURPOSES AND EDUCATIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF FASB ASC TOPIC 740, "ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES - AN INTERPRETATION OF FASB STATEMENT NO. 109", EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 2009. ADOPTION OF THE NEW GUIDANCE DID NOT HAVE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
Change in Value of Unconditional Promises to Give: 667960. CHANGE IN VALUE OF PERPETUAL TRUSTS: 3552814. CHANGE IN VALUE OF PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS: -14337.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS' PERFORMANCE AND PROGRESS IS CLOSELY MONITORED BY COPIES OF GRADES FURNISHED BY THE RECIPIENTS EACH SEMESTER AND ON-CAMPUS VISITS BY A MEMBER OF THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: DAVID R. SAULTZ (EMPLOYEE OF RELATED ORGANIZATION, CAL FARLEY'S BOYS RANCH FOUNDATION) RECEIVED A SEVERANCE PAYMENT OF $101,252.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FAY MOORE (DIRECTOR) AND ENTITIES CONTROLLED BY HER, ARE INVESTORS IN A REAL ESTATE PARTNERSHIP OF WHICH CHRIS STORM (DIRECTOR) IS THE OWNER OF THE GENERAL PARTNER. BILLY ATTEBURY (DIRECTOR) INVESTS IN OIL AND GAS PROPERTIES OWNED, MANAGED OR PROMOTED BY TOM ROACH (DIRECTOR). WHILE THESE INVESTMENTS ARE IN THE ORDINARY COURSE OF BUSINESS, THEY ARE NOT OFFERED TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC. HAROLD COURSON (DIRECTOR) IS THE GRANDFATHER OF TANNER ALEXANDER (DIRECTOR).

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 FOR THIS COMPANY WAS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE CPA FIRM AND REVIEWED BY the BUDGET AUDIT COMMITTEE PRIOR TO SIGNING AND MAILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE IS SENT TO DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS ANNUALLY. THE PRESIDENT AND CEO ENSURES THAT ALL ARE COMPLETED AND MAINTAINED ON FILE IN THE OFFICE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A COMPENSATION STUDY IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY REGARDING THE CEO'S SALARY. THE RESULTS ARE PRESENTED TO THE BOARD FOR DELIBERATION AND ULTIMATE SALARY DETERMINATION AS PART OF THE CEO'S ANNUAL EVALUATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE FORM 990.

THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THIS COMPANY WERE AUDITED BY AN OUTSIDE INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM. THE BUDGET AUDIT COMMITTEE OVERSEES THE AUDIT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART I, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ON SERVING GIRLS AGE 16 AND UP-EACH GIRL MUST BE RECEPTIVE TO OUT-OF-HOME PLACEMENT TO "RESET HER COURSE" TOWARD HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION AND SUCCESSFUL TRANSITION TO ADULTHOOD. CAL FARLEY'S ALSO OPERATES ITS SIGNATURE FAMILY RESOURCE CENTERS IN AMARILLO, AUSTIN, DALLAS/FORT WORTH, HOUSTON AND SAN ANTONIO. CAL FARLEY'S SUCCESSFUL WORK WITH THE FAMILIES OF THE CHILDREN IN ITS CARE HAS LED TO EXPANDED SERVICE IN EACH OF THESE CITIES - THE CAL FARLEY FAMILY RESOURCE CENTER BEING A UNIQUE NATIONAL MODEL IN AVERTING DOMESTIC CRISES AND STRENGTHENING FAMILIES. PLEASE SEE WWW.CALFARLEY.ORG FOR MORE INFORMATION.
